thread.title: Cold weekend ahead across Carolinas with rain chance early next week
thread.title_full: Cold weekend ahead across Carolinas with rain chance early next week

author: @WBTV_News
title: Cold weekend ahead across Carolinas with rain chance early next week
text:
Cold weekend ahead across Carolinas with rain chance early next week
Highs to be in 40s Saturday, Sunday
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (WBTV) - Cold weather is coming up across the Carolinas this weekend with more on the way next week.
Friday morning is starting off chilly with lows down near 30 degrees or below around Charlotte, and in the mid-20s in the mountains. High temperatures in the Queen City will be in the lower 50s, and in the low to mid-30s toward the mountains. There is a chance for some late-day snow in the High Country.
Saturday will be even colder, with highs only making it to the lower 40s in Charlotte, and in the 20s in parts of the mountains. Sunday will also stay cold with highs only a couple degrees warmer. There is a moderate chance for some late-day precipitation.
A First Alert is in place for Monday due to likely morning rain. That rain could fall in snow form in the High Country. Highs will be in the lower 50s in Charlotte.
Beyond that, high temperatures will only make it to the low to mid-40s Tuesday and Wednesday before falling into the 30s on Thursday.
